The poor have me; the rich need me. Eat me and you will die. What am I?
I have branches but no fruit, trunk, or leaves. What am I?
What word contains all of the twenty-six letters?
What has a head and a tail, but no body or legs?
What has many words but never speaks?
Which word in the dictionary is spelled incorrectly?
I am a solitary word, 5 letters long. Behead me once, I am the same. Behead me again, I am still the same.
They come at night without being called and are lost in the day without being stolen. What are they?
I am lighter than air, but a hundred people cannot lift me — I’m too fragile. What am I?
